strings.Value: [Give Irovetti the crown] "I surrender at the discretion of the wiser ruler."
"No, Irovetti, I didn't come to give you my crown. I came to take yours!"
"Moskoni! Attack him as we planned! Bring me Irovetti's head, and I'll make you governor!"

{n}Irovetti towers over you, standing proudly on the steps of his palace. He greets you with a condescending smile.{/n} "Well, hello, {mf|King|Queen}! I'm glad to see that despite your utter failure as a ruler, you did listen to the voice of reason and made the only right decision. Give me your crown and swear allegiance to me. I promise, I shall rule your lands wisely and mercifully!"

"So, henceforth I shall be the King of {g|Pitax}Pitax{/g} as well as the {g|Shrike}Shrike Hills{/g}, {g|Varnhold}Varnhold{/g}, and the adjacent territories. Here is my first order... For {mf|his|her} multiple crimes, the deposed {mf|King|Queen} {Name} is sentenced to death. The sentence will be carried out immediately! Guards, take {mf|him|her}!"
"Citizens of free {g|Pitax}Pitax{/g}! Our city is in danger! The enemy is at the gate! To arms! For our freedom! For your King!"

{n}Irovetti stands proudly on the steps of his palace, looking down on you with noble indignation.{/n} "This is how you {d|c51 Attack Pitaxians}repay{/d} me for my kindness!? After you've proven your utter ineptitude as a ruler, I generously offer to free you of the unbearable burden of the crown. I open the gates of my capital to you — and you bring carnage to my streets!"

"That's a lesson to all those you've tricked into betraying me... Yes, I know all about it! Now everyone can see that this so-called {mf|king|queen} can't be trusted? But I am kind. I forgive everyone who gave in to {mf|his|her} lies and false promises. There's no time for faction! — We must protect our city from this treacherous usurper! To arms, my loyal subjects! For {g|Pitax}Pitax{/g}!"
